text:
so guys I was thinking over the weekend on this.

here’s kind of an ultra slimmed down version of what’s currently in the doc - but would be more doable, would not require people to be sent out within a short period of time to a second conference, and would address the very important problem of providing a good experience for those who could not physically attend.

We still do presentations - but each person who is presenting pre-records their presentation in advance.

Presentations get livestreamed basically like a playlist. For those at the event we’ll have a projector, for those not at the event you can watch and chat along in real time with the people who are physically there.
The presentations would not be done live. The projector however would be showing the exact same stream people who physically couldn’t make it are watching. Enabling people to comment on it in real time.

Presenters could take that opportunity to also do Q&A through slack or the stream’s chat.

The event would occur at a bar in their “party” space or if HubSpot has a space in their offices we could borrow that would also be cool.

The one part I don’t have a solution for is Emmets Bar.

The benefits of this simplified version - no need for microphone, - may still need speakers.

chairs hopefully would already exist at the venue.

Both online and in-person attendees get a similar great experience, no one is left waiting for a long time to get access to the content.

presenters have already done everything so they don’t need to worry about bringing anything or bringing their A-Game.

No need hopefully - to rent tables/bars
only sponsorship needed would be to reserve the space at the place we go to, and the projector +screen
Cons would be video quality for the presentations would vary as presenters may record their presentations in their office/home. having a good microphone would be encouraged.
